summary: A new settlement and a few dungeons for Enderal!
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#a4c2f4][u][size=6]Clockville[/size][/u][/color]
[color=#3c78d8]And the Betrayed


[color=#ff0000]WARNING:
After Enderal patch 1.2.3.0, this mod of mine will likely cause a CTD. I will be attempting to solve this issue shortly.[/color]

[/color]Welcome my friends, to my biggest mod yet! Using Enderal's resources, I have crafted a whole new and vibrant settlement in Enderal, far up north in the Goldenforst. Included in it is a written history of the town, as well!
I was inspired by the look of Majora's Mask, and loved the autumn nature of the region. I may come out with future updates of this mod, but we'll see; I know I need to get back into Skyrim proper some day for everyone.
Most notably, this mod supplies the player with
[color=#00ff00]- The town has 3 new merchants and several wandering npc's with basic packages
- A priest that can cure you of diseases
- A secure, beautiful castle-town as a home for exploring the rest of Goldenforst
- A new Player Home in a history square-tower style keep

[color=#ffffff]Besides for by foot, there's no Myrad that travels to the town. Haven't figured that out. BUT, there is a new 'teleportation tome' next to the Myrad tower at the Farmer's Coast that will take you right there!


Besides the new town, the mod also comes with a new text-driven quest to discover the whereabouts of the castle's former tenant, the venerable Keeper of the Order, Myrrdin Dal'Wylt, and the treasures he left behind!
The quest starts once you enter the castle and discover the note left behind on the throne. Clues will lead you to the Lighthouse, and from there, there are 2 new worldspaces to explore. I recommend being at least level 10 or higher for the Rime worldspace. Admittedly, these are small things, and a little rough around the edges, but I hope everyone enjoys nonetheless!

*If you are having difficulty finding certain things for the quest, give me a personal message and I'll walk you through, no problem!

It is my thanks for SureAI doing such a remarkable job on this beautiful game.
I also hereby give SureAI permission to use what I have done for any future updates of theirs, if they so choose.
For now it is English Only, but I give permission to anyone who would want to translate!

Thank you everyone, and have a Merry Christmas and all other happy holidays!

[/color][/color][/center]
author: ClefJ
